tutorial.label: What's New in 3.4
tutorial.description:
This panel describes some of the new features and behavior changes included in this update.

To open this panel again later, select Help > What's New in Android Studio from the main menu.

stepElement.section: The new Project Structure Dialog (PSD) makes it easier to keep dependencies updated and configure different aspects of your project, such as modules, build variants and variables, and signing configurations. Open the PSD by selecting File > Project Structure from the menu bar. Learn more

The Resource Manager is a new tool window for importing, creating, managing, and applying resources to your app's layouts. You can open the tool window by selecting View > Tool Windows > Resource Manager from the menu bar. Learn more

R8 integrates desugaring, shrinking, obfuscating, optimizing, and dexing all in one step—resulting in noticeable build performance improvements. R8 was introduced in Android Gradle plugin 3.3.0 and is now enabled by default for both app and Android library projects using plugin 3.4.0 and higher. Learn more
In addition to enabling R8 by default, the latest version of the Android Gradle plugin includes build performance improvements, a new lint check dependency configuration, and more. Release notes

step.label: Navigation Editor supports all argument types

stepElement.section: All argument types supported by the Navigation Jetpack component are now supported in the Navigation Editor. Learn more

The Attributes pane in the Layout Editor has been streamlined into a single page with expandable sections that reveal attributes you can configure.

This pane also includes new UI elements that indicate when attributes reference resources, and flag errors and warnings, such as invalid or hard-coded values. Learn more

step.label: New intention for quickly importing dependencies

stepElement.section: If you start using certain Jetpack and Firebase classes in your code, a new intention action suggests adding the required Gradle library dependency to your project, if you haven’t already done so. Learn more

The core Android Studio IDE has been updated with improvements from IntelliJ IDEA through the 2018.3.4 release.


Last updated 4/2/2019
